properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 11 at 2:32PM MST until January 13 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Boise ID
properties.description:
...WINTER STORM CONTINUES OVER PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN IDAHO AND
SOUTHEASTERN OREGON...

.Periods of snow will continue over most of southwestern Idaho and
southeastern Oregon into early next week. The heaviest snow will
occur in the West Central Mountains of Idaho, where more than a
foot of new snow will fall. Snow may let for a few hours at times,
but this will be a generally continuous period of snow in the
mountains. The lull in the snow will be a bit longer across
eastern Oregon, the southwest highlands of Idaho, and in southern
Twin Falls County but snow will increase again late tonight and
continue on and off through Monday morning. An inch or two of new
snow is still possible in the Treasure and Magic Valleys with this
storm as well.

* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total
snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches, with up to 6 inches in the
mountains. Winds gusting as high as 30 mph may cause a few spots
of blowing and drifting snow along the highways.

* WHERE...Harney County and Malheur County zones.

* WHEN...From 9 PM MST /8 PM PST/ this evening to 5 AM MST /4 AM
PST/ Monday.

* IMPACTS...Difficult travel conditions
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM MST /8 PM PST/ THIS EVENING TO 5 AM MST /4 AM PST/ MONDAY
